algorithm_technique: Iterate through the matrix, summing primary and secondary diagonals, handling the center element overlap.
problem_summary_simple: Sum the elements on both diagonals of a square matrix, counting the center element only once.
problem_summary_technical: Iterate through a square matrix, summing primary diagonal (mat[i][i]) and secondary diagonal (mat[n-1-i][i]), subtracting the center element if n is odd.
key_insights: The primary diagonal elements are at indices (i, i).
The secondary diagonal elements are at indices (i, n-1-i).
The center element (n//2, n//2) is common to both diagonals when n is odd, requiring subtraction to avoid double counting.
